pageTitle: Buses diversions in Bromley town centre for Diamond Jubilee celebrations

title.title: Buses diversions in Bromley town centre for Diamond Jubilee celebrations

texts: Buses serving Bromley town centre will be on diversion on Tuesday 15 May while the Queen's Diamond Jubilee celebrations take place.

Roads in the town centre will be closed from 08:00 to 14:00 and the following bus routes will be diverted due to local road closures: 61, 119, 126, 138, 146, 162, 208, 227, 246, 261, 269, 314, 320, 336, 352, 354, 358, 367 and 402.
Buses on some routes will be stopped short of their final destinations due to road closures.

Passengers using buses in the area are advised to allow extra time to complete their journeys and check how their route is affected by visiting the TfL website for the latest travel news or by calling Transport for London's Travel Information Centre on 0843 222 1234.
There will also be information provided at bus stops advising passengers where they can catch their bus.
